instruction: Create an example input for the following task - Summarize the following document with several bullet points.
input: An article published on October 10th, 2019 titled "Women Move Closer to Majority on Corporate Boards"
output:
Mitt Romney leads spending on TV advertising among presidential contenders. 
Lower TV production costs allow more candidates to advertise.
Interest groups have spent $6.2 million on TV ads for state and local ballot measures in the first nine months of this year. 
Issue-advocacy television ad spending totals $270 million this year. 
Romney used TV ads to introduce himself to Republican voters as a social and fiscal conservative. 
Richardson's humorous TV ads introduced him as a solid second-tier candidate. 
Up to $639 million could be spent on television advertising in the fight for Congress. 
Cuts through the clutter of ads are a challenge for contenders and interest groups.
